text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Iraqi press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Three truckloads of medicine donated by Japanese people arrive in Iraq.
- Newly-appointed chairman of the U.N. Special Commission Richard Butler says his meeting with Aziz was friendly.
- Iraqi Turkman community stages protest in front of the Turkish embassy against Turkish invasion of northern Iraq.
- Iraq conducts a successful experimental census in five Iraqi provinces in preparation for a general census that will be held by the end of this year.
- Sixty vessels loaded with foodstuffs purchased under the oil-for-food deal with the U.N. have anchored in Um Qasr since the beginning of this year.
(The above were also carried by IRAQ and JUMHOURIYA)
- The Turkish army decides to extend the presence of U.S.-led force in Turkey before the parliament's decision.
- Iran is close to being able to produce nuclear weapons.
